archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Tandoori Roast Whole Chicken with Saffron Jeera Rice and Mint Raita
description: A showstopper tandoori-style whole chicken roasted until charred and juicy, served with aromatic saffron jeera rice and a cooling mint-cucumber raita.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Place a rack over a roasting tray.
Pat dry the whole chicken and remove excess moisture.
In a large bowl, whisk yoghurt, lemon juice, canola oil, garlic (finely minced), salt, pepper, garam masala, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, and turmeric powder.
Make shallow slashes on the chicken legs and breasts; rub marinade all over and under the skin. Marinate 4–12 hours in the fridge (cover).
Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Warm 2 tablespoons water and crumble saffron into it; set aside.
Thinly slice red onion for pickle; mix with apple cider vinegar, sugar, and a pinch of salt; set aside to quick-pickle.
Grate or finely chop cucumber; squeeze out excess water. Chop mint finely.
In a bowl, mix yoghurt (for raita) with cucumber, mint, salt, pepper, and a pinch of cumin; chill.
cook_steps: Roast the chicken: Place the marinated whole chicken on the rack. Roast at 220°C/425°F for 15 minutes to char.
Lower oven to 180°C/350°F and continue roasting 50–70 minutes, until juices run clear and thickest thigh reads 74°C/165°F. Rest 15 minutes before carving.
Cook the rice: In a pot, heat ghee over medium. Add cumin seeds and bay leaves; let them crackle 30 seconds.
Add sliced onions with a pinch of salt; cook 6–8 minutes until soft and lightly golden.
Stir in drained basmati rice; toast 1 minute. Add water, salt, and the saffron water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat; rest covered 10 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Slice the chicken. Serve over saffron jeera rice with a side of mint raita and the quick-pickled red onions.
